info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 03 at 6:59PM EDT until May 03 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL WESTMORELAND AND NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 659 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mount Pleasant, or 9 miles south of Greensburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Calumet-Norvelt, Everson, Donegal, Champion, Acme, and Jones Mills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
